page.title: 01Redlynch
page.content: Redlynch is situated at the northern end of a shallow valley to the east of the ridge which forms the eastern slope of the {Avon}valley.To the north lie chalk downs.London clay forms the valley bottom and towards the N.E. rise Reading beds with some plateau gravel. The area is one of sparse linear development surrounded by pasture and scattered copses with extensive woodlands towards the east and south. The main settlement lies at the head of the valley and straggles through an area known as Quavey,to the southern settlement of{Lover}where the church,subpost office cum shop,garage ,school and Forester's Arms are situated.Housing spans several centuries with Victorian and modern properties filling gaps between older scattered cottages.
